Key Match Events: The Utah Jazz fell short in their season opener against the Memphis Grizzlies, losing 126-124.
Pre-Game Insights: Despite inking Lauri Markkanen to a long-term max extension, few expect Utah to make a push for the playoffs in a loaded West.
Post-Match Reflections: The Jazz enter the season with a new look after finishing 12th in the Western Conference last season with a 31-51 record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Center Walker Kessler and guard Johnny Juzang look to make a leap in their third year.
Point guard Keyonte George hopes to take the next step after wearing down late in his rookie season.
Others: CEO of Basketball Operations Danny Ainge brought in sixth-year veterans Svi Mykhailiuk and Drew Eubanks along with 15-year pro Patty Mills for some veteran leadership on and off the court.
